messages.subject: Funny movies
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/18/2004 5:48:25 AM Eastern Standard Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes: **One of my best is cheery music, cheery movies I m not
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/18/2004 5:48:25 AM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
**One of my best is cheery music, cheery movies
I'm not sure what you find appropriate for your son, so you may want to get
reviews of these before going out and renting them. My daughters are 11 and 14,
and have just started to be allowed to watch these types of movies over the
past year. But I am incredibly too picky -- according to my sister.
Nine Months
Sweet Home Alabama
Grumpy (and Grumpier) Old Men
How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days
Miss Congeniality
Run Away Bride
Bewitched episodes
Scooby-Doo (not animated, but those are funny, too)
Freaky Friday.

Hope this helps,
Shannon


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
